steps.title: You can uninstall and reinstall drivers easily in the Device Manager.
steps.content: You can uninstall and reinstall drivers easily in the Device Manager. Here's an easy way to get there: Press the Windows key on your keyboard. Type device manager . Click Device Manager in the search results.

steps.title: Click the arrow next to "Display adapters."
steps.content: Click the arrow next to "Display adapters." This shows you all graphics drivers that are currently installed.

steps.title: Double-clicking the driver name opens its properties window.
steps.content: Double-clicking the driver name opens its properties window. This new window will open to the General tab.

steps.title: This is the second tab at the top of the window.
steps.content: This is the second tab at the top of the window. You'll see several options for your driver here, including the option to uninstall it.

steps.title: Before the driver is deleted, you'll see a confirmation message on the screen.
steps.content: Before the driver is deleted, you'll see a confirmation message on the screen. This message asks if you also wan to delete the driver for this device.

steps.title: Check the box next to "Attempt to remove the driver for this device" before you confirm.
steps.content: Check the box next to "Attempt to remove the driver for this device" before you confirm. This ensures that the driver is actually removed from your hard drive.
